data.title: Dinner experience
data.text: Food was great. Service staff had a HUGE attitude. Won't go back for that reason. The man seating people  was not friendly at all-he acted like we were a burden to be there. One waitress actually put her hand on my husbands upper arm and pushed him out of her way. It was unreal. Too bad because the food was really good.

data.title: Wow! What a Brew Pub and Bistro in Conroe
data.text: This is a rare location which features  outstanding gourmet food  in their rotation of craft beers.  The beers are on a printed out  a sheet of paper, because  they don't last more than a few weeks  before rotated out. The cheeseburger and Filet Mignon pizza are the standouts, although everything was really pretty good. The restaurant  is located not too far from the railroad tracks in old downtown Conroe, Montgomery County, Texas and seems to blend in with the historic environment.  The staff  and owner were very friendly in this upscale  tavern.

data.title: I love this place!! Most unique restaurant!
data.text: It's always busy but they have the most unique food in Conroe! Its a medium size restaurant with a bar in the back. Lots of craft beers and mixed drinks. It is in unique downtown Conroe and the locals love it and they have live bands! I've been 3 times, once for date night before the play at Creighton Theatre next door and twice for a meal. I've eaten the pulled pork nachos that were amazing and the cornbread skillet with that whipped honey butter that was to die for! It's an appetizer and great for an entire group. The Tejano burger was another one I tried, I liked it, but I didn't like the bread and I usually LOVE sweet potatoes but was not impressed with theirs, I didn't like the Parmesan cheese topping. But they have so many options of unique food, I will try something different next time!! Will continue to go back and take all my friends!

data.title: A great place!!
data.text: Went her with some friends and found that they had great food, and they also had great craft beers on tap. Live music was good, waitstaff was very pleasant and attentive. Been here 2 times since and never been disappointed.

data.title: Bar Food
data.text: Once again this is a real sleeper in downtown Conroe, not if you know about this place of course. We see the same people when we go and always have a great time and good food. Search this place out worth the trip.

data.title: Evening with my boo
data.text: Excellent food and vast beer and wine selection. Great spot for date night and very cozy. Definitely will visit again.

data.title: Red Brick
data.text: Food is ok but it is too loud.  Not being a drinker it is really not the place for me.  It a good place to meet if you do not want to be able to hear.

data.title: Was great - quality falling?
data.text:
My wife and I used  to love to go to the Red Brick Tavern (2x's month), and recommended it to all of our friends and family.  It is still very friendly upon arrival but the food quality has fallen off over the last two months? Too me, it's a lack of seasoning and particularly their pulled pork enchiladas - a mainstay for us.
The reason I go there is for good food, to support the local businesses, and to have a good COLD craft beer to accompany my meal.  The last few times have been very disappointing and I do not know what's going on as the beer temperature is NOT  COLD?  They were saying that the tap hose holds heat and so they would empty the hose volume into a sink then when cold - into your glass. Craft beer experts state, "once the keg is tapped, the beer should NEVER be allowed to rise above 38F, and should be kept at 36F to ensure a cold glass."  I'm sure  that RBT does not keep  their beer that cold - or, they need good and accurate temperature gauges and control systems.  
RBT is still recommended but they are going to loose their "beer customers" if they do not address this issue.

data.title: Town Favorite
data.text: Red Brick is AWESOME. There's live music, excellent food, outstanding pizza, huge beer selection, friendly staff. This is a favorite for locals.

data.title: Great Pub
data.text: Called in for a couple of drinks .. Probably the best pub in the area by far .. Great service and the foods pretty darn good too

data.title: Something Unique in a town of Bland!
data.text:
This is the ONLY place in Conroe that is a bit different. The food is excellent and not what you would expect. Just tucked in off of the main square, this historic and rustic building adds to the appeal and experience.

Make sure you try the Sunday Brunch! A touch of southern fare along with your breakfast favorites.

On the weekends, stop in to listen to some great live music, enjoy a brew and of course enjoy the food.

Don't miss this place. Of course you could just go to all of the other restaurants in towns that are chains and franchises! NOT!  

Enjoy!

data.title: Good nacho's
data.text: Went there with my husband after reading reviews.  I had the pulled pork nacho's which were very good. My hubby had their meatloaf that he said was good.

data.title: Great local place
data.text: This was our second visit and are glad we came. Did call ahead seating and there was a table waiting for us. Good beer and drink selection. Friendly staff and clientele. Lots of choices of food from pizzas, salads, burgers and steaks. Or just come in for drinks and apps. Reasonable prices. Band started at 8 but we had to leave before then. Need to come back when we can stay longer.

data.title: Roll of the dice
data.text: Been here numerous times since they opened. The menu is not as good as when they first opened, the food can be very tasty or just okay, and the service, well, it is just as varied as the food. If you hit it at the right time it is great.

data.title: Downtown Conroe Jewel!
data.text: This little place is in downtown Conroe and is small but what they lack in size they make up for in charm and good food! On weekend nights  it's more of a bar scene with live music which is awesome! Waitress was friendly and helpful definitely stop by and give it a try!

data.title: Good live music - not so good food.
data.text: Undoubtedly, this is the place to go if you like live music, but don't go if you are looking for good food and conversation.  I ordered the meatloaf, mashed potatoes and green beans.  The meatloaf was VERY dry - had a little bit of barbecue sauce poured over it.  They put a SMALL soup of mashed potatoes on top of the meatloaf (??).  The green beans were ok, but nothing to write home about.  I had to ask the waiter for more sauce to dip the meatloaf in and there were barely enough mashed potatoes for one bite.  When the music started up, I could hardly hear my date speaking to me, so we eventually decided to leave.  Probably won't be back....unless we're just there for drinks and music.

data.title: Don't Go
data.text:
The service was terrible.  The food was poor at best.

This is first and last time i will go to the establishment.  If you go, drink a lot before, during, and after.

data.title: Delicious Food and Friendly Atmosphere
data.text: The meal choices should appeal to any American appetite. The portions are very generous and delicious. Everything was fresh and the presentation was nicely done. The service was professional and the atmosphere was very comfortable.

data.title: Wonderful neighborhood place !
data.text: Food is great, staff is wonderful, only drawbacks are the occasional instances they run out of the specials and they are on a wait.

data.title: Fantastic place to eat!
data.text: Mile High Meatloaf is the B.O.M.B!  You won't be disappointed!  Great food, service & music. Family friendly and the best food in town, in my opinion!
